instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: 3209 vcore .7V
threads.message: have a 3209 with .7v on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>. Does this sound right? Schematic suggests 1.25v but I wasn't sure that if/when the machine was running that it would drop. Ideas? History is unknown.

threads.title: 3209 vcore .7V
threads.message: The question is does it even work?

threads.title: 3209 vcore .7V
threads.message: All power rails work, backlights seems to work but doesn't display.

threads.title: 3209 vcore .7V
threads.message: Dark screen or white? PRAM reset possible?

threads.title: 3209 vcore .7V
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 23854"]Dark screen or white? PRAM reset possible? [/QUOTE]

The screen is dark, but it is getting backlights boost.  It's a known good screen and connector. The Apple on the top of the screen (backside ) lights up too. Just no display.

threads.title: 3209 vcore .7V
threads.message: PRAM possible? Checked with a known good LCD? If BKL is working there must be an image.
